IndustryData.title: Automotive & Aerospace
IndustryData.excerpt: Ensures simulations match real-world performance in aerodynamics and crash testing through parameter tuning.

firstParagraph.title: Model Calibration/Optimization
firstParagraph.content: Ensuring the accuracy of simulations in aerodynamics (CFD) and crash testing (FEA). Adjusting parameters like material properties, boundary conditions, and forces to match real-world performance. Accurate extraction of material properties such as Youngâ€™s modulus, fatigue limits, and stress-strain behavior for structural simulations.

secondParagraph.title: Inverse Design
secondParagraph.content: Aerodynamic shape optimization, where the desired performance (e.g., minimum drag or lift coefficient) is specified, and design variables are adjusted to meet these goals.

IndustryData.title: Photonics & Optics
IndustryData.excerpt: Adjusts simulation parameters for accurate photonic device performance and tailored optical responses.

firstParagraph.title: Model Calibration/Optimization
firstParagraph.content: Ensuring that PICs and other photonic devices perform as expected. Adjustments in parameters like layer thickness, waveguide geometries, or coupling efficiencies.

secondParagraph.title: Inverse Design
secondParagraph.content: Designing complex components like metamaterials and nano-photonic devices. Specifying a desired optical response (e.g., a specific wavelength filtering), and the simulation automatically adjusts parameters like geometry and material properties to achieve that result.

IndustryData.title: Manufacturing & Engineering
IndustryData.excerpt: Optimizes manufacturing process simulations by fine-tuning tool and material parameters for better efficiency.

firstParagraph.title: Model Calibration/Optimization
firstParagraph.content: Optimization for higher efficiency and quality by fine tuning parameters like tool speed, material hardness, and temperature simulating processes like CNC machining or additive manufacturing.

secondParagraph.title: Inverse Design
secondParagraph.content: Working with additive manufacturing, where the desired material properties or part geometry are defined, determining the optimal manufacturing parameters (e.g., print speed, layer height) to achieve the target output.

IndustryData.title: Energy Systems & Sustainability
IndustryData.excerpt: Calibrates renewable energy system models to match real-world output and optimize energy production.

firstParagraph.title: Model Calibration/Optimization
firstParagraph.content: Calibrating parameters such as energy output, weather conditions, and efficiency to match real-world performance when simulating power systems and renewable energy sources like wind or solar farms.

secondParagraph.title: Inverse Design
secondParagraph.content: Optimizing renewable energy systems, where the goal (e.g.,maximizing energy output or minimizing energy loss) drives the design of turbine placements, grid connections, or panel orientations.

IndustryData.title: Robotics & Autonomous Systems
IndustryData.excerpt: Tunes robotic models for realistic performance and path planning by adjusting key simulation parameters.

firstParagraph.title: Model Calibration/Optimization
firstParagraph.content: Tuning of parameters of a robotic simulation model like joint stiffness, motor torques, and friction to ensure the robot behaves as expected in real-world applications.

secondParagraph.title: Inverse Design
secondParagraph.content: Robot path planning or gripper design, where the desired movement path or object handling is specified, determining determines the optimal joint angles, speeds, or gripping force to achieve the objective.

IndustryData.title: Biomedicine & Pharmaceuticals
IndustryData.excerpt: Aligns drug simulation data with clinical outcomes for optimized therapeutic effects and delivery methods.

firstParagraph.title: Model Calibration/Optimization
firstParagraph.content: Ensuring that simulations accurately predict how drugs behave in different patient populations. Comparing model predictions with clinical data optimizing dose response or therapeutic windows. Optimization routines help adjust dosing regimens or drug formulations to maximize efficacy while

secondParagraph.title: Inverse Design
secondParagraph.content: Tailoring drug properties and delivery methods to achieve a specific pharmacological response. Targeting a drug to release at a particular rate or location in the body (e.g., in the digestive tract or bloodstream) where desired release profiles dictate the formulation parameters (e.g., polymer coatings, dissolution rates).
